reviewText: If Animals could watch movies, they would love this just as much as kids love it. What's not to love? The movie has a great, moral, story that teaches a lesson every child should learn - and it does it in a fun way! disguising it as not to make it so boring. Its a great family film, mainly for kids though.Your kids will not be disappointed! The music is good and the animal action is just hilarious! Oh and GREG GRUNBERG IS FUNNY
Title: N/A

reviewText: A terribly cute film (how can a baby tiger not be cute?)Clichés: It has the typical boy hero, with the typical bland, pretty girl he likes, the typical pair of bullies that make him look like an idiot in front of her.  And a goofball friend (but this one is so goofball that he kind of goes beyond the cliché!) Also, the parents' financial snafu is solved at the end by the same typical plot device we've seen in a million other movies and episodes of Bewitched.But in addition to the sheer cuteness, all the child actors playing the roles chew up the scenery with gusto, and make the movie entertaining and well worth a watch.Willing suspension of disbelief will be required by adults when meeting 'Safari Park' a roadside zoo with a kind, caring owner, where the animals are kept happily in tiny concrete-lined chain-link enclosures with no security WHATSOEVER to prevent a kid sticking his hand into the tiger or wolf cage to be gnawed on, apart from the kindly oversight of the owner. (And where baby tigers can sneak out unseen while the cage is being cleaned...)
Title: N/A

reviewText: Take a tiger cub, dog, and a light humorous story, mix them together, and instant thumbs up approved flick for the little ones.A tiger's cub hides away in a boy's packback at a animal refuge.  The boy tries, at first to tell his unbelieving family while driving home, "There's a tiger in the car!", to their disbelief; so, instead, he hides the cute critter in his room.  His dog barks, the cub tears apart the house, and the parents are clueless.  What child wouldn't love it?The filming gears, almost completely, to the animals.  Our youngsters(7&10) laughed and ooh'ed and ah'ed at the antics of such adorable creatures, especially, the bathing scene with the cub.  There's, also, a side story about bullying and friendship, but, overall, it's very mild.Well shot, the story and acting are fine for kids. As a grown-up, I enjoyed the animal shots, and the fact that our children could relate to clean, fun film.  They say part 2 is on the way, and include outtakes and more animal shots at the end.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Fun for the whole family.  Story is about a boy, Billy, who accidentally brings home a tiger cub and the crazy time he has trying to return the adorable little tiger.  Just so it is clear, I am connected to the production, but I just fell in love with that sweet tiger cub and wanted to say some nice things about a movie that has positive messages.  I recommend it for family viewing of all ages from little kids to grandparents.
summary: Who doesn't love watching a baby tiger play with a dog?

reviewText: This movie is so cute! I picked it up for my 6-year-old nephew who watches it on repeat, but it's entertaining for older kids too.
